results.title: West Germany: industrial giant
results.brief_description: Covers the regions of Western Germany and the character of the people in the various areas of the country. Surveys the heavy industries of the Ruhr Valley and the craft industries spread throughout the rural areas. We see the mountains, the Rhine, Munich, Hamburg and Bonn.

results.title: West country journey
results.creator_credit: Syd Sharples, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Shows examples of scenery and features which give the counties of Devon and Cornwall their attractive character. Includes the multi-colored pattern of the Devon countryside; the rivers, moors, old historic buildings at Totnes, Dartmouth and Exeter; tiny ports and naval docks at Devonport and the long sandy beaches of Cornwall. Photography by Ronald Craigen.

results.title: Well, what are you doing now?
results.brief_description: This is a unique video made by a group of older Australians which promotes positive images of older adults in a range of community recreation activities. The group have demonstrated their capacity to master technical audio visual equipment and produce a challenging VHS video.

results.title: Well, if you ask me
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the difficulties of eliciting opinions from within a group. Two executives are clear in their objections to the location of a new plant. However, once inside the boardroom they say nothing and the proposal is passed without objection. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Well laid plans (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Central to all management action is planning and decision making. Both involve information collecting and making choices. In some situations it is best to involve others in the process. Planning and decision making in situations of high certainty are considered in the context of present day management culture.

results.title: Welfare of the workers
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Jennings, GPO Film Unit and Great Britain. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Shows efforts by the British government to maintain production during the war. Many working men and women were required to relocate to factories away from their home town to support the changing production demands of war. Recognising that the health, safety and welfare of workers was critical to victory, various programs were implemented to assist relocated workers. These varied from locating suitable accommodation, providing health services and ensuring that recreational activities were available to workers during their leisure time. New lighting and ventilation designs were also introduced into factories to compensate for the conditions caused by the blackouts that were enforced during aerial attacks.

results.title: Welcome to Television (1956)
results.brief_description: Gyngell is often credited as being the first person to appear on Australian television on 16 September 1956, when he spoke the words, ‘Good evening, and welcome to television’.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.
